channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Improving Post-Processing of Audio Event Detectors Using Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We apply post-processing to the class probability distribution outputs of audio event classification models and employ reinforcement learning to jointly discover the optimal parameters for various stages of a post-processing stack, such as the classification thresholds and the kernel sizes of median filtering algorithms used to smooth out model predictions.

item.title: UniCausal: Unified Benchmark and Model for Causal Text Mining
item.description: Therefore, we proposed UniCausal, a unified benchmark for causal text mining across three tasks: Causal Sequence Classification, Cause-Effect Span Detection and Causal Pair Classification.

item.title: Crafting Monocular Cues and Velocity Guidance for Self-Supervised Multi-Frame Depth Learning
item.description: In contrast, multi-frame depth estimation methods improve the depth accuracy thanks to the success of Multi-View Stereo (MVS), which directly makes use of geometric constraints.

item.title: Cold Diffusion: Inverting Arbitrary Image Transforms Without Noise
item.description: We observe that the generative behavior of diffusion models is not strongly dependent on the choice of image degradation, and in fact an entire family of generative models can be constructed by varying this choice.

item.title: UKP-SQuARE v2 Explainability and Adversarial Attacks for Trustworthy QA
item.description: In this paper, we introduce SQuARE v2, the new version of SQuARE, to provide an explainability infrastructure for comparing models based on methods such as saliency maps and graph-based explanations.

item.title: Ginex: SSD-enabled Billion-scale Graph Neural Network Training on a Single Machine via Provably Optimal In-memory Caching
item.description: Thus, we propose Ginex, the first SSD-based GNN training system that can process billion-scale graph datasets on a single machine.

item.title: Diffusion-based Time Series Imputation and Forecasting with Structured State Space Models
item.description: The imputation of missing values represents a significant obstacle for many real-world data analysis pipelines.

item.title: PyMIC: A deep learning toolkit for annotation-efficient medical image segmentation
item.description: We aim to develop a new deep learning toolkit to support annotation-efficient learning for medical image segmentation, which can accelerate and simply the development of deep learning models with limited annotation budget, e. g., learning from partial, sparse or noisy annotations.

item.title: Diverse Video Captioning by Adaptive Spatio-temporal Attention
item.description: To generate proper captions for videos, the inference needs to identify relevant concepts and pay attention to the spatial relationships between them as well as to the temporal development in the clip.

item.title: SAFARI: Versatile and Efficient Evaluations for Robustness of Interpretability
item.description: Interpretability of Deep Learning (DL) models is arguably the barrier in front of trustworthy AI.

item.title: An Unsupervised Short- and Long-Term Mask Representation for Multivariate Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: Anomaly detection of multivariate time series is meaningful for system behavior monitoring.

item.title: Dialogue Policies for Confusion Mitigation in Situated HRI
item.description: Confusion is a mental state triggered by cognitive disequilibrium that can occur in many types of task-oriented interaction, including Human-Robot Interaction (HRI).

item.title: Expressing Multivariate Time Series as Graphs with Time Series Attention Transformer
item.description: We further visualize the embedded dynamic graphs to illustrate the graph representation power of TSAT.

item.title: Curbing Task Interference using Representation Similarity-Guided Multi-Task Feature Sharing
item.description: However, increased sharing exposes more parameters to task interference which likely hinders both generalization and robustness.

item.title: Spatial Temporal Graph Attention Network for Skeleton-Based Action Recognition
item.description: In such conditions, short-term dependencies are few formally considered, which are critical for classifying similar actions.

item.title: VAuLT: Augmenting the Vision-and-Language Transformer with the Propagation of Deep Language Representations
item.description: VAuLT is an extension of the popular Vision-and-Language Transformer (ViLT), and improves performance on vision-and-language tasks that involve more complex text inputs than image captions while having minimal impact on training and inference efficiency.

item.title: Shadows Aren't So Dangerous After All: A Fast and Robust Defense Against Shadow-Based Adversarial Attacks
item.description: Robust classification is essential in tasks like autonomous vehicle sign recognition, where the downsides of misclassification can be grave.

item.title: Musika! Fast Infinite Waveform Music Generation
item.description: We release the source code and pretrained autoencoder weights at github. com/marcoppasini/musika, such that a GAN can be trained on a new music domain with a single GPU in a matter of hours.

item.title: RFLA: Gaussian Receptive Field based Label Assignment for Tiny Object Detection
item.description: Then, instead of assigning samples with IoU or center sampling strategy, a new Receptive Field Distance (RFD) is proposed to directly measure the similarity between the Gaussian receptive field and ground truth.

item.title: Out-of-distribution Detection via Frequency-regularized Generative Models
item.description: In particular, generative models are shown to overly rely on the background information to estimate the likelihood.

item.title: Reproducibility Report: Contrastive Learning of Socially-aware Motion Representations
item.description: The following paper is a reproducibility report for "Social NCE: Contrastive Learning of Socially-aware Motion Representations" {\cite{liu2020snce}} published in ICCV 2021 as part of the ML Reproducibility Challenge 2021.

item.title: Implicit Session Contexts for Next-Item Recommendations
item.description: Session-based recommender systems capture the short-term interest of a user within a session.

item.title: Is Monte Carlo a bad sampling strategy for learning smooth functions in high dimensions?
item.description: We show that there is a least-squares scheme based on $m$ MC samples whose error decays algebraically fast in $m/\log(m)$, with a rate that is the same as that of the best $n$-term polynomial approximation.

item.title: Unifying Visual Perception by Dispersible Points Learning
item.description: The method, called UniHead, views different visual perception tasks as the dispersible points learning via the transformer encoder architecture.

item.title: Restoration of User Videos Shared on Social Media
item.description: This paper presents a new general video restoration framework for the restoration of user videos shared on social media platforms.

item.title: Machine learning algorithms for three-dimensional mean-curvature computation in the level-set method
item.description: We propose a data-driven mean-curvature solver for the level-set method.

item.title: Challenges and opportunities in applying Neural Temporal Point Processes to large scale industry data
item.description: In this work, we identify open research opportunities in applying Neural Temporal Point Process (NTPP) models to industry scale customer behavior data by carefully reproducing NTPP models published up to date on known literature benchmarks as well as applying NTPP models to a novel, real world consumer behavior dataset that is twice as large as the largest publicly available NTPP benchmark.

item.title: Visual Pursuit Control based on Gaussian Processes with Switched Motion Trajectories
item.description: This paper considers a scenario of pursuing a moving target that may switch behaviors due to external factors in a dynamic environment by motion estimation using visual sensors.

item.title: L3: Accelerator-Friendly Lossless Image Format for High-Resolution, High-Throughput DNN Training
item.description: The decoding process of L3 is effectively parallelized on the accelerator, thus minimizing CPU intervention for data preparation during DNN training.

item.title: A Two-stream Convolutional Network for Musculoskeletal and Neurological Disorders Prediction
item.description: As a result, we propose a solution that explicitly takes both individual joint features and inter-joint features as input, relieving the system from the need of discovering more complicated features from small data.

item.title: Temporal Up-Sampling for Asynchronous Events
item.description: The main idea of our algorithm is to generate up-sampling events on the event motion trajectory.

item.title: Quality issues in Machine Learning Software Systems
item.description: This empirical study aims to identify a catalog of bad-practices related to poor quality in MLSSs.

item.title: Adaptive Re-Ranking with a Corpus Graph
item.description: Search systems often employ a re-ranking pipeline, wherein documents (or passages) from an initial pool of candidates are assigned new ranking scores.

item.title: Learning Spatial-Frequency Transformer for Visual Object Tracking
item.description: To handle these issues, in this paper, we propose a unified Spatial-Frequency Transformer that models the Gaussian spatial Prior and High-frequency emphasis Attention (GPHA) simultaneously.

item.title: Modeling Two-Way Selection Preference for Person-Job Fit
item.description: To model the two-way selection preference from the dual-perspective of job seekers and employers, we incorporate two different nodes for each candidate (or job) and characterize both successful matching and failed matching via a unified dual-perspective interaction graph.

item.title: Mere Contrastive Learning for Cross-Domain Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Cross-domain sentiment analysis aims to predict the sentiment of texts in the target domain using the model trained on the source domain to cope with the scarcity of labeled data.

item.title: Exploiting Sentiment and Common Sense for Zero-shot Stance Detection
item.description: Meanwhile, ablation studies prove the significance of each module in our model.

item.title: KuaiRand: An Unbiased Sequential Recommendation Dataset with Randomly Exposed Videos
item.description: To facilitate model learning, we further collect rich features of users and items as well as users' behavior history.

item.title: A Unified Algorithmic Framework for Distributed Adaptive Signal and Feature Fusion Problems -- Part I: Algorithm Derivation
item.description: This paper focuses on the algorithm derivation of the DASF framework along with simulations demonstrating its performance.

item.title: Representation Learning for the Automatic Indexing of Sound Effects Libraries
item.description: Labeling and maintaining a commercial sound effects library is a time-consuming task exacerbated by databases that continually grow in size and undergo taxonomy updates.

item.title: Transcending XAI Algorithm Boundaries through End-User-Inspired Design
item.description: Using the explanation forms, we then conduct a user study with 32 layperson participants in the context of achieving different explanation goals (such as verifying AI decisions, and improving user's predicted outcomes) in four critical tasks.

item.title: Mind the Gap in Distilling StyleGANs
item.description: To further enhance the semantic consistency between the teacher and student model, we present a latent-direction-based distillation loss that preserves the semantic relations in latent space.

item.title: DCNNV-19: Uma rede neural convolucional profunda para detecção de COVID-19 em tomografias computadorizadas torácicas
item.description: This technical report proposes the use of a deep convolutional neural network as a preliminary diagnostic method in the analysis of chest computed tomography images from patients with symptoms of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) and suspected COVID-19 disease, especially on occasions when the delay of the RT-PCR result and the absence of urgent care could result in serious temporary, long-term, or permanent health damage.

item.title: ConMatch: Semi-Supervised Learning with Confidence-Guided Consistency Regularization
item.description: We present a novel semi-supervised learning framework that intelligently leverages the consistency regularization between the model's predictions from two strongly-augmented views of an image, weighted by a confidence of pseudo-label, dubbed ConMatch.

item.title: Efficient data-driven gap filling of satellite image time series using deep neural networks with partial convolutions
item.description: Based on previous work in computer vision on image inpainting, this paper shows how three-dimensional spatiotemporal partial convolutions can be used as layers in neural networks to fill gaps in satellite image time series.

item.title: DeepSportradar-v1: Computer Vision Dataset for Sports Understanding with High Quality Annotations
item.description: With the recent development of Deep Learning applied to Computer Vision, sport video understanding has gained a lot of attention, providing much richer information for both sport consumers and leagues.

item.title: Transformer Encoder for Social Science
item.description: In this paper, we propose a compact pretrained deep neural network, Transformer Encoder for Social Science (TESS), explicitly designed to tackle text processing tasks in social science research.

item.title: Multimodal Lecture Presentations Dataset: Understanding Multimodality in Educational Slides
item.description: As a step toward developing AI to aid in student learning as intelligent teacher assistants, we introduce the Multimodal Lecture Presentations dataset as a large-scale benchmark testing the capabilities of machine learning models in multimodal understanding of educational content.

item.title: A Survey on Incomplete Multi-view Clustering
item.description: However, in practical applications, such as disease diagnosis, multimedia analysis, and recommendation system, it is common to observe that not all views of samples are available in many cases, which leads to the failure of the conventional multi-view clustering methods.

item.title: Position-aware Structure Learning for Graph Topology-imbalance by Relieving Under-reaching and Over-squashing
item.description: Topology-imbalance is a graph-specific imbalance problem caused by the uneven topology positions of labeled nodes, which significantly damages the performance of GNNs.
